property.description: Property sheet to hold XML specification for forms
Property sheet for storing discovery metadata
Display name to use for the plugin in Discovery UI
true since the Discover procedure for the plugin needs the plugin configuration to obtain credentials and connection information in order to run discovery on target resources.

procedure.description: Create a IIS configuration

formalParameter.description: Configuration Name
IP Address of IIS Server.
Port of IIS Server.
Computer name of the server that will run the scripts (e.g. srv01).

procedure.description: Delete an IIS configuration

formalParameter.description: The configuration name that will be deleted

procedure.description: Start a Website into an IIS Server

formalParameter.description: Provide the descriptive name of the web site you want to start. i.e: 'Default Web Site'. (Required)

procedure.description: Stop a Website into an IIS Server

formalParameter.description: Provide the descriptive name of the web site you want to stop. i.e: 'Default Web Site'. (Required)

procedure.description: Verifies if an Application Pool exists and if it doesn't, an IIS application pool is created.

formalParameter.description: The name of the Application Pool to create. i.e: 'FirstAppPool'. (Required)

procedure.description: Starts an Application Pool.

formalParameter.description: The name of the application pool to start. i.e: 'FirstAppPool'. (Required)

procedure.description: Stops an Application Pool.

formalParameter.description: The name of the application pool to stop. i.e: 'FirstAppPool'. (Required)

procedure.description: Assigns an application to an application pool.

formalParameter.description: The name of the Application Pool to assign the application. (Required)
The name of the application to assign. (Required)
The name of the site that contains the app to assign. i.e: 'Default Web Site'. (Required)

procedure.description: Use XCOPY to deploy Web Site or ASP.NET Application

formalParameter.description: Provide the relative or absolute path to the XCOPY (or similar) executable. (Required)
Provide the path to the source directory. i.e: 'C:\inetpub\wwwroot\test'.(Required)
Provide the path to the destination directory. This must be a physical directory, but it may have an IIS virtual directory pointing to it. i.e: 'C:\inetpub\wwwroot\copyTest'. (Required)

Indicate option switches for the XCOPY executable, excluding source and destination directories. The default options are those recommended by Microsoft for ASP.NET and IIS web site deployment; exercise caution when changing these options.
/E - Deep copy including empty dirs.
/K - Copy attributes.
/R - Overwrite read-only files.
/H - Copy hidden and system files.
/I - If the destination does not exist and you are copying more than one file, it is assumed that the destination is a directory.
/Y - Suppress prompting for overwrite confirmation.

procedure.description: Use MS Deploy to perform any actions with application.

formalParameter.description: Provide the relative or absolute path to the MSDeploy executable.

Web Deploy operations enable you to gather information from, move, or delete deployment objects like Web sites and Web applications. Web Deploy operations are specified on the command line with the -verb argument. The Web Deploy operations are dump, sync, delete, getDependencies, and getSystemInfo.

Providers process specific source or destination data for Web Deploy. For example, the contentPath provider determines how to work with directory, file, site, and application paths. On the Web Deploy command line, the provider name is specified immediately after the -source: or -dest: argument.
Specifies a path of the provider object. Some providers require a path and some do not. If required, the kind of path depends on the provider.

procedure.description: Use MS Deploy to perform undeploy of the application.

formalParameter.description: Provide the relative or absolute path to the MSDeploy executable.
A web site name to undeploy.
An application name to undeploy. Warning: if not specified, the web site with the name above will be undeployed.
Deletes the specified Web site or Web application, including any virtual directories and their content.

procedure.description: Use MS Deploy to deploy an application.

formalParameter.description: Provide the relative or absolute path to the MSDeploy executable.
A path to package (application.zip) or to directory which contains the content to be deployed.
A name of the web site to be deployed.
A name of the application to be deployed. If not provided, the content will be placed under the website.
Application pool name. If the application pool does not exists, it will be created.
To use version 3.5, install the appropriate version of .NET Framework and use product-specific guidelines.

If set to True for an application pool on a 64-bit operating system, the worker process(es) serving the application pool run in WOW64 (Windows on Windows64) mode. In WOW64 mode, 32-bit processes load only 32-bit applications.
Configures ASP.NET to run in classic mode as an ISAPI extension or in integrated mode where managed code is integrated into the request-processing pipeline.
Maximum number of requests that Http.sys queues for the application pool. When the queue is full, new requests receive a 503 Service Unavailable response.
If True, the application pool starts on creation or when IIS starts. Starting an application pool sets this property to True. Stopping an application sets this property to False.
Additional settings for application pool configuration, key-value pair one per line.

procedure.description: Check the HTTP status of a given URL

formalParameter.description: Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the IIS server. In this case, only credentials are taken from the configuration if the 'Use Credentials' parameter is checked. (Required)
Indicate if credentials must be used. If checked, the Commander use the user and password typed in the configuration.

procedure.description: Creates a virtual directory into the specified WebSite.

formalParameter.description: The website and virtual path to contain the Virtual Directory to create, i.e: 'Default Web Site/myapp02'. (Required)
Virtual path of the virtual directory, i.e: '/myvirtualdir'. (Required)
The absolute physical path of the Virtual Directory to create, i.e: 'c:/Inetpub/wwwroot/myvdir'. (Required)

procedure.description: Deletes a virtual directory into the specified WebSite.

formalParameter.description: The WebSite and virtual path that contains the Virtual Directory to delete. i.e: 'Default Web Site/' or 'Site1/myapp'. (Required)

procedure.description: Creates an application in IIS 7

formalParameter.description: The name of the webSite to add the application, i.e: 'Default Web Site'. (Required)
Virtual path of the application, i.e: '/myApplication'. (Required)
The absolute physical path of the application to create, i.e: 'c:/Inetpub/wwwroot/myApp'. (Required)

procedure.description: Deletes a web application into the specified WebSite.

formalParameter.description: The WebSite that contains the Application to delete. i.e: 'Default Web Site/' or 'Site1/myapp'. (Required)

procedure.description: List the sites on a web server.

formalParameter.description: The user-defined criterias to search the sites. Blank lists all sites. i.e: '/bindings:http/*:80:'.

procedure.description: View the apps of a WebSite

formalParameter.description: The name of the site to look for Applications. Blank lists all apps.

procedure.description: Create a WebSite.

formalParameter.description: The name of the WebSite to create. (Required)
List of bindings in the friendly form of 'http://domain:port,...' or raw form of 'protocol/bindingInformation,...' (Required)

If specified, will cause the root application containing a root virtual directory pointing to the specified path to be created for this site. If omitted, the site is created without a root application and will not be startable until one is created. (Required)
The id of the WebSite.

procedure.description: Delete a WebSite.

formalParameter.description: The name of the website to delete. i.e: 'Default Web Site/' or 'Site1/myapp'. (Required)

procedure.description: Add a binding to a WebSite.

formalParameter.description: The name of the WebSite to add a binding, i.e: 'Default Web Site'. (Required)
Protocol of the binding to add, i.e: 'http'. (Required)
Information of the binding to add, including the host and the port, i.e: 'localhost:443', '*:81'. (Required)

procedure.description: Delete an Application Pool.

formalParameter.description: The name of the application pool to delete. (Required)

procedure.description: Reset an IIS Server

formalParameter.description: Provide the absolute path of the script utility used to execute this step. If only 'iisreset' is entered, the 'iisreset' tool must be located on the system path 'c:/windows/system32'. i.e: 'iisreset' or 'c:/MyDir/IISFiles/iisreset.exe'. (Required)
Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the IIS server. (Required)

procedure.description: Start an IIS Server

formalParameter.description: Provide the host name of the IIS server. If the procedure is run on the host itself, use 'localhost'. (Required)

Provide the absolute path of the script utility used to execute this step. If only 'iisreset' is entered, the 'iisreset' tool must be located on the system path 'c:/windows/system32'. i.e: 'iisreset' or 'c:/MyDir/IISFiles/iisreset.exe'. (Required)

procedure.description: Stop an IIS Server

formalParameter.description: Provide the host name of the IIS server. If the procedure is run on the host itself, use 'localhost'. (Required)

Provide the absolute path of the script utility used to execute this step. If only 'iisreset' is entered, the 'iisreset' tool must be located on the system path 'c:/windows/system32'. i.e: 'iisreset' or 'c:/MyDir/IISFiles/iisreset.exe'. (Required)

procedure.description: Discover IIS instance configuration on a resources or environment

formalParameter.description: List of resources, on which discovery procedure should run. Enter multiple values on separate lines.

step.description: Discover IIS instance configuration on a resources

procedure.description: Discover IIS instance configuration on a resource

step.description: Discover IIS instance configuration on a resource
